person.summary:
Results-driven professional with over 20 years experience. Dynamic project leader of multi-disciplined engineering, procurement and construction (EPC) projects with experience in Asia-Pacific culture and business environments. Accomplished in project management from quotation through implementation for multi-million dollar programs. Experience in power generation, process automation, transmission and distribution, automotive, health care, and electronics industries. Continuously learning leader with a talent for training and developing resources. Exceptional educational qualifications including Engineering and Business degrees as well as PMP certification.

Specialties: Operations management, process improvement, project management, negotiation, financial analysis, training, coaching, business process analysis, DMAIC, Lean Six Sigma, Consulting

Partner with local execution teams and global Global Solution Centers to establish and maintain efficient operations that execute productive customer projects with minimal slippage and financial impact to the business.  Proactively work with project teams to ensure proper identification of risks and potential issues to maintain or enhance profitability.  Responsible to improve the global team competence around project execution to ensure world class capabilities exist and are utilized in Business Line Automotive.

Head of Integrated Project Management, responsible for coordinating all Project Management activities including training, certifications and process for Robotics.

person.headline: Head Of Customer Support bei ABB
person.summary:
I spent my entire carreer in the customer focused MV Drives service of ABB. 
At present I am leading the global level 3 support team with the domain experts of the MV Drives center in Switzerland. We focus on improving the quality by learning from field issues, giving remote support to minimize customer downtime and being the link between installed base and factory/development.

Starting as a field service engineer the focus was on troubleshooting and complex commissioning activities. This experience laid the ground of understanding customer processes and how to integrate our systems to fit the need of various industries best. 
Having that toolbox packed I stepped to the modernization engineering team to extend the life time of legacy drives by revamping the entire control system, including customer specific process automation systems.
From there I went into the remote customer support to learn escalation management, improve communication skills and being part of a team where each member is the expert of his products.

In the same team I developed from a drives specialist to a support manager and got the chance to lead this team since 2018.

My leading philosophy is to enable the team to work independent, having an open door atmosphere and to create a motivating/supporting team culture.

person.headline: Quality and Continuous Improvement ABB
person.summary:
With 13+ years of experience in quality and continuous improvement, I am a certified Lean Six Sigma Black Belt and a Certified in Logistics, Transportation, and Distribution professional. My mission is to deliver value to customers and stakeholders by optimizing processes, eliminating waste, and enhancing quality across various domains and industries.

Currently, I lead the quality and continuous improvement team at ABB, a global leader in electrification, robotics, and automation. I have successfully implemented multiple improvement projects at ABB, as well as at my previous roles at Ansaldo Energia and Smith and Nephew, resulting in increased efficiency, productivity, and customer satisfaction. I also have a strong background in project management, having obtained the Certified Associate in Project Management credential and an MBA in Lean Operations and Systems. I am passionate about learning new skills, collaborating with diverse teams, and driving innovation and excellence.

recommendationHistory.caption: January 26, 2024, Rochdy managed Julietta directly
recommendationHistory.description:
Within less 2 years with the quality and continuous team, Julietta did a remarkable job. Her approach to process improvement was methodical and she was always willing to push the thinking further to reach excellence. Julietta committed to extra tasks when required and always engaged to collaborate with peers and partners. She has the ability to reach consensus and agreement with the different stakeholders. A part from the continuous improvement field, Julietta handled the introduction of the new quality management system and related trainings with a great success. She is definitely an asset for ABB.
Thank you Julietta for your great work, your dedication and for being an attentive and empathetic human being.

recommendationHistory.caption: August 16, 2022, Reto managed Julietta directly
recommendationHistory.description: I can highly recommend Julietta Samson based on the excellent Process Improvement results she achieved in several different Ansaldo Energia Service functions. Based on her in-depth PI know-how, her strong initiative and her incredible co-operative way and integrative capability to work with different persons it was a great learning experience and pleasure  to work with her.

recommendationHistory.caption: June 26, 2022, Lorenzo M. A. worked with Julietta on the same team
recommendationHistory.description: I had the pleasure of working with Julietta in improving operations processes and her contribution has always been concrete and effective. Thanks to her hard skills and her kindness, the deliverables were always of top quality.

recommendationHistory.caption: June 24, 2022, valentina worked with Julietta on the same team
recommendationHistory.description:
It was an incredibly rare and enriching experience coming across a professional like Julietta! 
Implementing the S&OP process in a very complex environment was possible especially thanks to her patience and special ability of being open to a new organisational culture that seem to come naturally to her!
I will miss a lot her positive attitude and motivation of pushing always for improvements.
Julietta is the asset to have in every team. 
We will miss you 😟💪🏻

recommendationHistory.caption: June 24, 2022, Danilo worked with Julietta on the same team
recommendationHistory.description: Julietta has the great capability to properly lead the improvement processes , focusing the main topics, clearly summarizing and properly moderatingthe meetings, she never give up!

recommendationHistory.caption: June 22, 2022, Alessandra worked with Julietta but on different teams
recommendationHistory.description: I have had the opportunity to work with Julietta for the past two years and I appreciate her empathy and ability to build positive relationships with people. Beyond technical skills (she is an excelent process analyst) I would like to highlight that Julietta is a result oriented project manager, a result, however, that she does not achive alone but with the entire team. Being an excelent team player and change agent, she is considered an asset in fostering a positive organisational climate

recommendationHistory.caption: June 3, 2022, Yuri was senior to Julietta but didn't manage Julietta directly
recommendationHistory.description:
Julietta takes care of the details, she is a very good moderator and manages to schematize extremely complicated processes with incredible speed and clarity. 
She is open minded.
She is sensitive to business dynamics and is a driver of change.

recommendationHistory.caption: June 3, 2022, Davide was senior to Julietta but didn't manage Julietta directly
recommendationHistory.description: Julietta is a value for the Company as she owns the capabilities to transform her competences into value for the Company. This cannot be given for granted. Sometimes people have hard skills but they are lacking in soft ones. Julietta is not this case, no doubts about her knowledge in process improvement technical disciplines but I wish to underline her positive attitudes in working with teams and achieving results. Structured, methodical, assertive, kind, propositive, precise, there are qualities that everyone would like to have in own team.

recommendationHistory.caption: February 7, 2022, Francesco worked with Julietta on the same team
recommendationHistory.description:
There is only one word that comes to mind when I think of Julietta, and that is awesome!
I had the pleasure of working with Julietta as business analyst in several process improvements project.
As her colleague, I was always in awe of how she consistently kept everyone on the same page, avoiding any major conflict and enabling us to focus on our goals. And Julietta did it all with great empathy, creating a safe space for everyone.
As someone who has had a front-row seat to her work, I would have no hesitation in recommending Julietta to any potential businesses seeking new talent.

recommendationHistory.caption: October 11, 2019, Michael was senior to Julietta but didn't manage Julietta directly
recommendationHistory.description: Julietta was always a very driven, determined and keen colleague, she developed her team and the process in the warehouse to be benchmark in the Logistics / Distribution area. She applied Lean and Opex principles in a very smart and pragmatic way, always ensuring that the change was always driven by the employees. This also made her an excellent leader for her team and an excellent contributor for any project. additionally she is very good person to work with and will be a tremendous asset for any team, project or company.

recommendationHistory.caption: September 6, 2019, Axel was senior to Julietta but didn't manage Julietta directly
recommendationHistory.description: Julietta has a great working attitude. She worked successful in my team on key topics such a s Lean, Freight Cost Optimization and Auditing. She is a self-starter and takes the initiative to resolve issues on her own. She is defintly someone pushing improvements forward in a respectful way. Julietta is the type of employee not avoiding to go the extra mile to achieve great results. I had the opportunity to enjoy working with her.

recommendationHistory.caption: September 6, 2019, Oliver managed Julietta directly
recommendationHistory.description: Julietta is a great asset for our EMEA Supply Chain. She is a lean expert, very experienced in Project & Freight Management and easy to get along with. She is also a very open person who gets along with everyone. Julietta welcomes new challenges and always finds time to support others who need her advise and help. Julietta is very appreciated by everyone in our Supply Chain Organisation.

recommendationHistory.caption: September 5, 2019, Stephan managed Julietta directly
recommendationHistory.description:
Julietta is a great performer with a lot of energy and continuously striving for improvement in her work but also her personal development. 

She came into a completely new role as Freight Audit Specialist in my organization and was able to build a professional freight audit setup for the EMEA region within 1,5 Years. In that time she gained high level visibility in the organization and became a global SME (subject matter expert). 

I highly appreciate Julietta as a person and employee.

recommendationHistory.caption: September 5, 2019, Kurt was senior to Julietta but didn't manage Julietta directly
recommendationHistory.description: I worked with Julietta at Smith + Nephew where she was a key member of the EMEA Logistics Team.  Julietta truly reflected that leadership is not about title.  While she was not a manager at the time, Julietta was a true project manager, developing plans, working with all the stakeholders, regardless of level of detail required, and delivering (or many times over-delivering) results.  Julietta has a strong desire to constantly improve and grow, readily seeking feedback on her performance.  I would welcome Julietta into my organization and onto my team at any time.

person.headline: Quality & Reliability Expert (Wind Converters) | ABB | Ex-Emerson | M.Tech. Quality Management | B.Tech Electronics | LSS GB | IPC-A-610 CIS |
person.summary:
Quality & Reliability Expert with over 11 years at ABB, specializing in enhancing power electronics converter reliability and leading continuous improvement activities!

At ABB, I focus on improving the reliability of wind converters, conducting ALT and HALT testing, and employing data-driven approaches for predictive maintenance and field failure analysis. My previous roles involved qualifying power electronic components, designing test infrastructures, and performing root cause analysis for medium voltage drives. I also support new product introductions and lifecycle management with a strong emphasis on continuous improvement and operational excellence.

Key Skills
- Reliability Engineering
- Predictive Maintenance
- ALT and HALT Testing
- Data Analysis and Python Scripting
- Supplier Quality Improvement
- Root Cause Analysis & Continuous Improvement (DMAIC, FTA, 8D, FMEA, FMECA)
- Technical Sales Support
- Product Lifecycle Management

positionHistory.title: Quality & Reliability Expert
positionHistory.description:
- Responsible for Quality & Reliability of Wind Converters (12MW and above).
- Improve Reliability of components used in Wind Converters.
- ALT and HALT testing of components, assemblies and power units for lifetime estimation and improvement.
- Data driven approach for predictive maintenance and field failure analysis.
- Introduction of Automated Testing & SPC for Converter Testing.
- Supplier Quality Improvement through continuous quality improvement projects.

positionHistory.title: Sr. R&D Engineer (Reliability)
positionHistory.description:
•	Qualification of new Semiconductors (IGBT, Thyristor, Power Diode), Power Components (Capacitors, Inductors), HV Relays
•	Lifetime Testing for Power Electronic Components and System.
•	Design of Experiments for Root Cause Analysis using DMAIC process
•	Designing/ Improvising Test Infrastructure for 100% Screening
•	Electronic Prototyping for improving Reliability of existing Control HW
•	Product Technical Support (Pre and Post sales)
•	Designing Automated Testing for PCBA
•	New Product Introduction & Life Cycle Management
•	Python Scripting for Automated Testing & Data Analysis used in Reliability

positionHistory.title: Product Quality & Reliability Engineer, Medium Voltage Drives
positionHistory.description:
•	Product Coordinator for General Purpose Medium Voltage Drives in India.
•	Implementation of Global ECN for the drives manufactured in India
•	Localization Activities for drives manufactured in India
•	Conducting Type Tests & PFMEA of new product introduced for Indian market.
•	PCBA Analysis
-	Fault finding and root cause analysis of all the PCBA used in product. Expertise with Gate Driver Board, Voltage & Current Scaling & Measurement Boards, and Interface boards.
•	Root Cause Analysis
-	Field Failure Analysis for Medium Voltage Drives. In depth analysis of all the Power Electronic components used in the drive. Expertise with Thyristor, IGCT, IGBT and Choke analysis.
-	Simulations using Simulink and MATLAB for reproducing site conditions for analysis
-	DMAIC approach for all the failure analysis 
•	Technical Sales Support and After Sales Support. 
•	Building test setups (automated as well as manual) for module testing 
•	Work for Operational Excellence and Relentless Execution

recommendationHistory.caption: November 17, 2014, Alain worked with Florian on the same team
recommendationHistory.description:
I have worked with Florian for about 5 years at Avery Dennison. During this period Florian has occupied multiple positions with growing responsibilities.

After many years of 6sigma methodology as a way to drive continuous improvement within Avery Dennison Florian has been key in bringing Lean in manufacturing first and then Operational excellence across the whole business.

Florian was also the first one to develop the Strategy deployment process for the entire Avery Dennison corporation. Nowadays this process is still in place and is considered as a crucial element of Avery Dennison success.

Florian demonstrated throughout his different roles at Avery Dennison a strong sense of responsibility, attention to detail, a clear and rational mind, always following a known methodology. He brought stability and knowledge to our leadership team and incorporated his views of discipline and order to make our process more efficient and effective. 

His mastering of Operational excellence make Florian a valuable resource in a group environment. His contributions to executive management team were always constructive and positive. He is driven by performance and achievements and always ready to take on new challenges. 

I can recommend Floriann to any employer wanting to utilize his experience and expertise. Quick to find his place and learn, he can deliver on set goals faster than anyone else I was given the opportunity to manage.

I remain available for any questions you may have on the subject.

recommendationHistory.caption: June 2, 2008, Thierry worked with Florian on the same team
recommendationHistory.description:
Florian is an excellent Lean Sigma Growth champion.
He hahas particularly deep knowledge in facilitating Lean Sigma training and very efficient in leading/facilitating Kaizen Events.
His field of expertise is really various : From manufacturing to also transactional areas.
His level of expertise is very much appreciated within Avery.

person.headline: VP, Global Head of Quality & Continuous Improvement, Process Industry Division at ABB
person.summary:
ABB is a leading global technology company that energizes the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future. By connecting software to its electrification, robotics, automation and motion portfolio, ABB pushes the boundaries of technology to drive performance to new levels. With a history of excellence stretching back more than 130 years, ABB’s success is driven by about 110,000 talented employees in over 100 countries.

Marco is an experienced Executive Quality Manager in complex matrix organization for Energy industries with leadership skills and able to work in a multi-cultural environment implementing strategic changes. Strong international project management background and used to work and interact with Senior Management and Executive Directors. He also led global Quality organizations in Switzerland and other EU countries and established and deployed standards, cross-functional business processes and operating model across the enterprises. 

Marco globalized and simplified operations, led Lean Transformation and Operational Excellence initiatives and improved the end-to-end effectiveness of global value-chains and the associated Customer Satisfaction. Over the years, he successfully delivered improvement projects in different organization and stream work using Lean and Six Sigma methodologies.

positionHistory.title: VP, Global Head of Quality & Continuous Improvement, Process Industries Division
positionHistory.description: Leading the Division's Global Quality Performance along with creating and directing the Division/Business Unit implementation of Group wide initiatives and projects in order to improve customer loyalty, profitability, cash efficiency and supporting business growth.

positionHistory.title: Global Project Quality & Continuous Improvement Leader
positionHistory.description:
I develop framework for defining, deploying and maintaining processes for project quality management, driving process management optimization, in alignment with Business Unit (BU) Quality and Continuous Improvement strategic direction, to ensure flawless project execution for our customer. The leading organization covers #3 product groups, #6 regional HUBs with a presence in #35 countries, managing directly and indirectly a global team of more than #30 resources.
I ensure operational improvement, with efficient return of experience, by learning from quality issues and knowledge transfer from best practices. I develop the quality community in the BU about process management and best practice implementation, ensuring alignment with BU strategy on Quality and Continuous Improvement deployment. I drive process synergies across different product groups and hub locations, within the BU, ensuring flawless projects quality operation. Whenever required, I lead improvement workshops, using suitable quality tools (Lean, six Sigma, PDCA, Kaizen, FMEA, etc.), for implementing global change management initiatives and enhance process efficiency, measuring and monitoring business performance through KPIs. The purpose of my job is to raise BU project execution performance improving quality in operation to drive profitable growth.

positionHistory.title: HBU Continuous Improvement Leader & Quality Manager - Central, Southern & Eastern Europe
positionHistory.description:
Assure the effective implementation, maturity assessment and continuous improvement of all processes along the entire value chain to improve customer satisfaction and increase profitability in a safe working environment across the HBU organization and the local units.
Ensure consistency of processes and quality in a geographically and culturally wide-spread operation. Drive the implementation of the integrated HBU, differentiating from both local/regional and global competitors through quality, performance and reliability of the offering, working close to customers, value chain partners and understanding of local requirements, whilst driving an optimizing cost structure within the complete value chain of the HBU.

positionHistory.title: Quality Assurance Leader
positionHistory.description:
I led TAP Quality function developing and implementing the Quality Strategy and Quality Program to monitor and improve business processes. I led reviews & audits to assess process compliance during project execution, for suppliers and ECP contractors. I defined the training program, functional KPIs and metrics to improve operational performance and shareholders expectation.
I developed and functionally led the Quality Control organization of over 70 people (in Italy, Albania, Greece and manufacturing sites) that was responsible for the inspections and surveillance of supply chain and site activities.
In collaboration with IT department we implement digital transformation throughout the organization, increasing by 30% process digitization.

positionHistory.title: Senior Quality Assurance Advisor
positionHistory.description:
I was responsible of assuring the effective implementation, maturity assessment and improvement of all processes along the entire value chain to improve shareholders and stakeholders satisfaction and increase profitability across the business. 
Maintain the Integrated Management System, managing business audit program with the aim of improving processes across the business. I built and deploy continuous improvement strategy and roadmap based upon financial impact, availability of resources and timing concerns.

positionHistory.title: Global Head of Quality C&C, Gas Business
positionHistory.description:
I led a global team of 15 people in charge of development and maintenance of quality function in Construction & Commissioning organization for Alstom Power Gas Business. These responsibilities include maintenance of Quality Management System (QMS), resources management within the function, implementation of business quality strategy, create specific objectives and cascading the global campaigns to Construction & Commissioning population (about 400 people). I developed implemented and measured the performance of the function through proper Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) with the aim to enhance Customer Satisfaction.
I developed and implemented “Zero Deviation to Quality Control” program throughout the global organization aiming to train all site people on major “Critical to Quality” activities and to change site quality culture.
I coordinated and drove “Process Landscape Initiative” to improve function’s Quality Management System (QMS) reducing wastes to enhance Quality Performance. I develop yearly internal audit program and monitor its implementation throughout the whole organization and sites, participating as Lead Auditor during some of the audits.
I developed and drove continuous improvement strategy within the function ensuring the flawless execution of 8D, Lean, Six Sigma (DMAIC) and FMEA projects. Competency development was implemented with constant training to office and site personnel.

positionHistory.title: Head of Quality C&C, ELA Region
positionHistory.description:
I was responsible for Non-Conformance Report (NCR) and Experience Response Systems (ERS) processes in Construction & Commissioning organization. I analyzed NCR records to identify any corrective actions to improve quality reporting as well as to trigger specific actions to prevent re-occurrence of quality issues. I issued Quality Alerts to all sites related to major NCRs.
I produced key performance indicators (KPIs) reports for the organization and I implemented site Construction & Commissioning Road Map audit program to ensure high level of performance during site execution. I run 5 audits as Lead Auditor and I delivered training to office and site personnel.
I led and coordinate improvement projects to optimize Construction & Commissioning cost and efficiency. I led and implemented successfully one of the Gas business TOP 10 8D project to improve welding activities at site.

positionHistory.title: Constuction QA/QC Coordinator
positionHistory.description:
I implemented the function Quality Management System (QMS), based on ISO standards requirements, to ensure the fulfillment of legal, contract, client requirements and Foster Wheeler Italiana (FWI) policies. I prepared QMS audits schedule and executed audits at construction sites.
I prepared, reported and analyzed Construction sites Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and coordinated internal improvement projects to optimize cost and improve efficiency during site execution.

Projects executed during the employment:
- DOW Chemicals: Set Cogen Plant Project (Stade - Germany)
- TOTAL: D11 Distillation Unit Revamp (Harfleur - France)
- EXXON MOBIL: Cogeneration Project (Augusta - Italy)
- OMV PETROM: DAV2/CX3 Revamping Projects (Poliesti - Romania)
- GSK Biological: WN-158 Project (Wavre - Belgium)

positionHistory.title: Construction Engineer
positionHistory.description:
I monitored with periodical audits quality activities for all Foster Wheeler Italiana (FWI) sites. I prepared project Construction procedures and specifications applicable to FWI personnel and subcontractors based on contractual requirements. I prepared projects Quality Control Plan including relevant Inspection & Test Plan (ITP) and quality form sheets. I supported and verified the close-out of Non-Conformity during execution phase.

Projects executed during employment:
- EXXON MOBIL: Hydrotreater Project (Antwerp - Belgium)
- HELLENIC PETROLEUM: Trup Project (Thessaloniki - Greece)
- OMV PETROM: Amine Project (Ploiesti - Romania)
- SARAS: Mild Hydrocreacker (Cagliari - Italy)
- PDVSA: El Palito Rafinery Expansion Project FEED (El Palito - Venezuela)
- ISAB ENERGY: Hydrogen Plant (Priolo - Italy)

company.name: Schindler Group
company.description:
The Schindler Group is a leading manufacturer and provider of related services for elevators, escalators, and moving walkways. 

Founded in 1874 in Switzerland, our company is at the forefront of industry innovation, working on pushing the boundaries of technological engineering, while having a strong focus on safety, comfort, efficiency and reliability. 

Moving more than two billion people each day, our products can be found in many well-known buildings throughout the globe, including office and residential buildings, airports, shopping centers/retail establishments and specialty buildings. 

We’re a leading employer in the industry, with over 69’000 engaged employees enabling mobility within the urban world. We have a network of over 1000 branch offices in over 100 countries, as well as production sites and research and development facilities in the US, Brazil, Europe, China and India.

At Schindler, our mission is to keep the world moving. 

We Elevate… Our World

person.headline: VP | Head of Quality @ Franke Group | MBA
person.summary:
As the VP | Head of Quality and a member of the Global Leadership Team at Franke Group, I am responsible for driving the quality strategy, standards, and culture across the organization. I have over 10 years of experience in leading quality, process, and in various industries, including automotive, medical, and industrial solutions.

My core competencies include implementing and maintaining integrated management systems (IMS) based on ISO 9001, 13485, 14001, and PART 820, developing and executing new business concepts and solutions, and managing international teams and projects across different cultures and regions. I am also a certified executive master of business administration (EMBA) and a high performance leadership (HPL) graduate from prestigious institutions. I am passionate about continuous improvement, innovation, and excellence, and I aim to deliver value and satisfaction to Franke's customers and stakeholders.

person.headline:
Managing Director: Infrastructure, Energy, Turnaround and Sustainability
P&L up to 600 MUSD | Global Teams of 500+ | Global Market Leadership
person.summary:
With more than 25 years of leadership experience in the energy, building services, and industrial sectors, I excel at building and inspiring diverse teams across geographies and cultures, delivering large-scale projects and driving growth. My expertise lies in developing solutions to complex business challenges and driving the change required for effective implementation.

My achievements include the development and implementation of a global quality strategy for Schindler, leading the Schindler Top Range business to record sales and global market leadership, and the turnaround and profitable growth of the Alstom Power Service business in China.

I am passionate about sustainable technology and have recently completed a Certificate in Sustainability at MIT, expanding my expertise in this area. I am now seeking a position or mandate, preferably with a company focused on sustainable technology or clean energy, where I can leverage my experience to deliver impactful results.

Luca is a specialist in Quality Methods and Industrialization with a good background in R&D and team management.

Strong of over 20 Year experience and excellent skills in working in a cross functional multinational environment, Luca is Leader of Supplier Quality Audit & Approval process on group level, fulfills the task as SCQM & SCQM+ Implementation Manager and initiates the continuous Improvement Management in the Schindler Supply Chain worldwide.

Luca is Swiss, he is fluent in Italian, French and has a complete professional knowledge of English and German

His values are Trust, Respect and Loyalty

person.summary:
Multi-lingual Continuous Improvement and Quality Assurance Manager with a Mechanical Engineering background (first class honours degree) and more than 15 years international experience in global companies

---> Quality Assurance / Quality Control (QA / QC), quality management systems auditor (ISO 9001), project quality management, quality & risk methods (8D, 5W, Ishikawa, Pareto, FMEA), problem solving skill, scrum

---> Six sigma green belt, lean six sigma black belt trained, DMAIC, continuous improvement, process oriented approach, change management

---> Project Management, contract management, negotiation and communication skills

---> Target oriented, customer focused, analytical skills, intellectual curiosity and structured working method

---> Highly determined and enthusiastic professional used to live and work in multicultural environments. Extremely versatile with team player mindset and passion for excellence

positionHistory.title: Process and Quality Assurance Manager
positionHistory.description:
Member of the global quality department and responsible for ensuring process compliance during the product development in the elevator branch.
Main activities:
- Lead, deploy and improve Quality Assurance by ensuring that qualified processes, tools and methods are established and aligned with company Organization Norms
- Drive continuous improvement initiatives by identifying opportunities to enhance the organization performance and by leading various cross-functional improvement projects 
- Spread a quality culture providing training, coaching and applying a range of quality methods
- Apply a holistic approach consisting of auditing, analyzing, implementing actions and optimizing processes in order to improve the operational excellence

positionHistory.description:
Responsible for ensuring quality compliance from contract award to customer acceptance of products in the project execution quality department in the power generation business.
Main activities:
- Ensured quality by measuring, reporting and implementing actions to solve project issues
- Ensured that the project team understands the implications of contract requirements regarding quality and their application in the local environment (regulations, standards)
- Interfaced with customers on all quality issues. Coordinated the execution of customer hardware inspections (over 100) and the implementation of required corrective actions
- Issued project specific procedures, work instructions as well as inspection and test program
- Reviewed, analysed and followed-up on project non-conformities and deviations.

Projects: Pembroke (United Kingdom), Samra IV (Jordan), Samra III Add-On (Jordan), Riyadh PP12 (Saudi Arabia), North Bangkok 2 (Thailand).

positionHistory.title: Project Manager

- Planned and organized the maintenance activities (site condition, personnel, spare parts, repairs, tools) coordinating the tasks of all different departments and suppliers
- Ensured the execution of the site activities from a contractual, quality and EHS standpoint
- Coordinated unscheduled needs, customer technical complaints and potential follow up

Main customers: Total E&P (Nigeria, Gabon), British Gas (Tunisia), Veolia (Belgium), Petrofac (Kazakhstan), Suez Environnement (France).

issues come up and require to be solved within strict time schedule.

recommendationHistory.caption: May 8, 2014, Jérôme worked with François on the same team
recommendationHistory.description: I appreciated working with François for his accountability and rigor in execution. François never gives up when facing tough challenges and always tries to understand the best approach to meet his goals. Moreover, he's a real team player ready to  support his peers with his expertise and looking for feed backs to improve his own performance. His optimism and open mindset make François a real pleasure to work with.

recommendationHistory.caption: April 7, 2014, Daniel worked with François but on different teams
recommendationHistory.description:
Having worked very closely with Francois over the last one year on an extremely challenging project, I can testify that he is a very professional,  focused and committed individual who is not afraid to be hands-on. 

Francois is able to keep the big picture in mind, while at the same time not failing to keep his focus on the finer details, which is what his position as Project Quality Manager demands him to be. company.name: Schindler Group
company.description:
The Schindler Group is a leading manufacturer and provider of related services for elevators, escalators, and moving walkways. 

Founded in 1874 in Switzerland, our company is at the forefront of industry innovation, working on pushing the boundaries of technological engineering, while having a strong focus on safety, comfort, efficiency and reliability. 

Moving more than two billion people each day, our products can be found in many well-known buildings throughout the globe, including office and residential buildings, airports, shopping centers/retail establishments and specialty buildings. 

We’re a leading employer in the industry, with over 69’000 engaged employees enabling mobility within the urban world. We have a network of over 1000 branch offices in over 100 countries, as well as production sites and research and development facilities in the US, Brazil, Europe, China and India.

At Schindler, our mission is to keep the world moving. 

We Elevate… Our World

positionHistory.title: Brand Builder (Field Sales Executive)
positionHistory.description:
Plan and execute the Territory initiatives (Retail and Consumer), according to the approved plan, budget and internal practices, in order to guarantee KPI accomplishment, namely in what regards to market share and volumes.

Responsibilities:

•	Develop the plan for the Territory, taking into consideration market analysis & dynamics, competitive activities, trade structure, brand and consumer data, as well as required resources and expected results, in order to maximize volume and profit growth.
•	Implement Trade initiatives (namely trade programs, incentive campaigns, retail training), according to Deployment guidelines and Area plan, in order to optimise availability, visibility, trade and consumer engagement.
•	Foster profitable business relations with Point of Sale (POS) owners and staff (Retail) providing professional and high quality services through negotiating trade programs, in order to promote PMI as a preferred business partner and responsible Company image.
•	Ensure that all initiatives maximize return on investment and drive adult smoker's choice towards PMI brands.
•	Manage own workload by maximizing the Commercial Planning Manager guidelines for mandatory activities and the approved flexible activities.
•	Analyse territory internal (consumer data, sales data, channel investment, etc) and external data (Retail and Consumer feedback), in order to identify useful information and build territorial insights.
•	Develop strong business acumen in what regards to the Territory and Area, through continuous analysis of the dynamics, competitors, opportunities and challenges in all channels, in order to ensure that the company proactively and timely takes advantage and sustains leadership in the market.

positionHistory.title: Corporate Environment, Health and Safety Manager
positionHistory.description:
- Promoting and strengthening awareness and improving performance in the field of occupational health and safety (OHS) on a global level - with an accident-free company as the goal
- Monitoring the effectiveness of the OHS policy and implementing optimization projects with the production plants and logistics in order to achieve the strategic goals in the OHS area
- Maintenance and further development of the integrated management system (section ISO 45001) and ensuring the implementation of the group-wide safety system (including groupwide safety standards, guidelines and training)
- Leading the global safety team, building an international OHS community and supporting the production plants by promoting and accompanying best practice approaches in the field of OHS
- Responsibility for the SAP EHS modules for incident management and hazardous substance management
- Responsibility for the rollout of a global solution for EHS Legal Compliance
- Preparation of an OHS quarterly report as well as a comprehensive annual report
- Management of various projects as part of the sustainability strategy and support of the team at the annual global EHS meeting as well as the annual sustainability reporting
- Health and Safety Manager for a local company part of the Group.

positionHistory.title: Head of Occupational Health and Safety
positionHistory.description:
- Advise the management board on Occupational Health and Safety (OHS) topics and steps to achieve the company safety goals.
- Develop and regularly update the OHS Management System.
- Advise internal customers to fulfil legal requirements. 
- Support line managers in identifying hazards, conducting risk assessment and defining control measures.
- Plan and give safety training.
- Develop and conduct safety training courses and updates them regularly.
- Create specifications for emergency planning at fixed and non-stationary workplaces. 
- Plan and organize approved safety awareness campaigns. 
- Support those responsible for buildings/facilities/sites in implementing the physical security requirements for their facilities.
- Coordinate common topics with the specialist unit workplace health promotion. 
- Audit construction sites, facilities and other workplaces with line managers to check compliance with legal requirements and internal/local safety standards. 
- Monitor and evaluate performance related to OHS (using statistics and key figures).
- Make suggestions for improvement in deviations from the yearly goals and improve the OHS management system.

- Review QHSE clauses in contracts with clients, contractors and suppliers to ensure legal and best practice compliance.

person.headline: Management Systems expert with 25+ years of experience in Quality, EHS and Nuclear Safety. Supporting transformation and business continuity in a fast-changing world.
person.summary:
My mission in VAT is to implement a Safety Culture framework to support application of our products in those industries where protection of the workers, the public and the environment are especially demanding. 

I come from 28 years of experience in the Power industry (Ansaldo, ABB, Alstom, GE) in Engineering, Quality, EHS and Information Systems. I personally set up the Quality management system of GE Steam Power in 2016, and I was responsible for its deployment and certification for eight years, including change management through multiple business transformations.

I have a solid technical background and a creative mind-set coming from many international experiences – ranging from early schooling in the US, to short term assignments abroad. These experiences allow me to work in diverse environments and to easily connect with people - bringing them together.

Italian, born in Milan, I moved to Switzerland in 2009 with the family.
Open, multicultural, communicative, passionate, punctual, reliable, honest.

recommendationHistory.caption: September 8, 2024, Pascale worked with Roman but on different teams
recommendationHistory.description:
Ein Mann der Taten, wie ich Roman als Arbeitskollegen kennenlernen durfte. In seiner Funktion als Interim Global Manager & Q-Berater leistet er mit seinen Topqualifikationen, hoher Führungskompetenz und wertvollen, internationalen Erfahrungen einen hervorragenden Job. 
Für das Amt als Gemeindepräsident sehe ich Roman als qualifizierten Kandidaten. Er kennt sich nicht nur auf internationaler Ebene bestens aus, er ist auch durch seine politischen Aktivitäten mit nationalen, kantonalen und kommunalen Themen bestens vertraut. Schon seit über 10 Jahren bin ich selbst Mitglied einer kommunalen Behörde und weiss, worauf es ankommt. Eine wichtige Fähigkeit für dieses Amt ist das Zuhören. Roman Rauper hat diese Fähigkeit, aber nicht nur diese – er hat auch ein sehr gutes Gespür für Menschen und kann sie gut einschätzen. Wer sich weiterentwickeln möchte, wird von ihm unterstützt. Aufgrund seiner guten Menschenkenntnisse und seines erstaunlichen Erfahrungsschatzes schafft er gute Teams zu bilden und gemeinsam Lösungen mit sinnvollen Ideen zu entwickeln. Zweifellos wird er die richtigen Personen an den Tisch bringen. Er hat das Format für das Gemeindepräsidium!
Könnte ich, würde ich Roman Rauper am 22. September 2024 wählen!

recommendationHistory.caption: May 8, 2024, Caroline reported directly to Roman
recommendationHistory.description:
Roman is both professional and entertaining which is a rare skill these days! He is capable of driving change while maintaining positive engagement with people at all levels of the business. 

I have learned a lot while working with Roman and believe he has a much to offer any business that engages his services.

recommendationHistory.caption: May 7, 2024, Christoph was Roman’s client
recommendationHistory.description: Die Zusammenarbeit mit Roman ist stets positiv und lösungsorientiert. Roman ist ein echter Macher, mit seiner Erfahrung und pragmatischen Herangehensweise konnten alle Projekte zeitnah und erfolgreich umgesetzt werden. Ein toller Typ mit einer offenen Kommunikation und kritischem Denken, mit dem ich sehr gerne zusammenarbeite.

recommendationHistory.caption: April 20, 2024, Claudia worked with Roman on the same team
recommendationHistory.description: Roman and I have been working together for almost 2 years. I have not only got to know him as someone who can quickly and thoroughly familiarise himself with new tasks and teams, but who also introduces innovations and quickly achieves results. His professional demeanour demonstrates his extensive knowledge and experience, and his open and motivating manner makes working with him both results-oriented and pleasant. Even though the work of an interim manager in a company is limited in time, I hope that the collaboration with Roman will continue for some time to come.

recommendationHistory.caption: October 6, 2021, Maximilian reported directly to Roman
recommendationHistory.description:
In meiner langen Berufslaufbahn durfte ich mit sehr guten Managern zusammenarbeiten. Alle von Ihnen verfügten über Qualitäten welche ein gesundes Unternehmen auf Erfolgskurs hielten. 
Nun begegnete ich den Interim Manager Roman Rauper. Anfangs liess ich mich durch seine hervorragenden rhetorischen Fähigkeiten nicht beeindrucken.  Diese Fähigkeiten erwartete ich mir von einem guten Manger, und von dieser Sorte gibt es viele auf dem Markt. Roman Rauper hat aber Qualitäten welche den Mehrwert eines „sehr guten“ Managers übertreffen. Daher erlaube ich mir folgende Fähigkeiten von Roman Rauper öffentlich mit ausgezeichnet zu bewerten.
Fähigkeit des kritischen und analytischen Denkens, Prägnantes Argumentieren und Handeln, Zuhörfähigkeit, Fähigkeit zum Delegieren, Flexibilität und Anpassungsfähigkeit alle mit der Note „Ausgezeichnet“.
Ebenfalls bin ich begeistert, wie schnell sich Roman Rauper in unterschiedliche Thematiken einarbeiten konnte und somit eine sofortige Entlastung brachte. Natürlich sind das Eigenschaften, welche man sich schon von einem guten Manger erwartet, und zweifellos von einem Interim Manager, aber ich bin auch überzeugt, dass Roman Rauper hier immer einen Schritt voraus ist.
Roman Rauper bringt somit einen Mehrwert in jede Organisation was auch Akzeptanz und Sicherheit der geführten Mitarbeiter mit sich bringt. Von einem Interim Manager erwartet man, dass er wertvolle Impulse von aussen einbringt, Verantwortung übernimmt und Kosten und Zeitrahmen klar definiert. Roman Rauper geht über diese Erwartungen hinaus. Zugegeben, manchmal muss man aus seinem gewohnten Muster austreten, wenn man gemeinsam mit Roman Rauper den Erfolgsweg gehen möchte.

recommendationHistory.caption: January 20, 2021, Daniel was Roman’s client
recommendationHistory.description: It was me a pleasure to work with Roman. A real expert on many topics (not just quality).  We have developed many strategies and processes together and have been very successful. I learned a lot from him. Roman demanded a lot from the employees, but at the same time encouraged them and coached if necessary. I really appreciated the way we worked together.

recommendationHistory.caption: January 14, 2021, Marco Andrea managed Roman directly
recommendationHistory.description: Roman Rauper schafft es, in kürzester Zeit eine Firma zu verstehen und mit nachhaltigen Lösungsansätzen aufzuwerten. Roman weiss wie man Ressourcen effizient einsetzt und Kosten and den richtigen Stellen substantiell senken kann ohne die Substanz anzugreifen. Kurz ein Top Turnaround Manager den ich jederzeit empfehlen kann!

recommendationHistory.caption: January 11, 2021, Klaus worked with Roman on the same team
recommendationHistory.description: Roman ist ein „Natural Leader“ mit einer schnellen Auffassungsgabe und außerordentlichen Analysefähigkeiten. Er entwickelt sehr schnell zukunftsorientierte Lösungen, auch für komplexe Probleme und Herausforderungen. Roman ist ein hervorragender Stratege, aber trotzdem hands-on und steht mit beiden Beinen fest auf dem Boden. Es war eine grosse Bereicherung und Freude mit Roman zusammen zu arbeiten.

recommendationHistory.caption: July 3, 2020, Twan worked with Roman on the same team
recommendationHistory.description:
Roman is best in driving constructive change. During a period of 2 years I worked with Roman on continues improvement projects, were we both acted as work package leaders.
During this period, Roman presented himself as somebody that keeps his commitments, dedicated and fully understanding quality and it merits. Pushing with business units for the best possible solution within the framework of reasonableness whilst honouring and improving process standards. Well-developed customer requirement acknowledgement, and communication skills.
As a businessperson, positive, open and direct, always business oriented and the ability to uphold his professional posture at all times. Pleasant personality and colleague to work with as team player.

recommendationHistory.caption: June 22, 2020, Heinz reported directly to Roman
recommendationHistory.description:
Kind of a pity that you will leave us already, but with the future potential you have to do so. :-)
No chance, so fast I won't forget your name, which means on the other hand it was really great to work with you and I also hope that our paths will cross again. Wish you the very best Heinz.

recommendationHistory.caption: June 16, 2020, Paul worked with Roman on the same team
recommendationHistory.description: I had the pleasure working with Roman for more than 5 years, Roman combines technical knowledge and superior people skills to execute key goals for his team. Roman is an out-of-the-box thinker and he works to use the strengths of each team member. I strongly recommend Roman  to any organization that is looking for leadership, direction and high quality overall business / technology / market / product and performance development in today's increasingly global competitive environment.

recommendationHistory.caption: June 11, 2020, Martina worked with Roman on the same team
recommendationHistory.description: It was a great opportunity to work with Roman. He always had good approaches, supported and motivated the team in every respect. I wish you all the best for the future.

recommendationHistory.caption: June 11, 2020, Ronald worked with Roman but on different teams
recommendationHistory.description:
Hi Roman!
I am sorry to learn you are about to leave our company, and I will truly miss you. 
You have always been a very knowledgeable partner in many business aspects,
and also a good and trustful friend.
All the best and good luck
Ronald

recommendationHistory.caption: May 2, 2020, Markus reported directly to Roman
recommendationHistory.description:
Roman in a few sentences - that's tough :-)

Roman is an absolutely authentic person, which leads into an honest, straight and confident communication. He is a strong strategist, who connects the puzzle pieces in such a way that the complete team and organization will be strengthened. He is realizing this with a strong vision, a lot of passion and personal support, especially by sharing his knowledge and experiences with the team. One highlight is for sure that he is accepting every challenge that improves or protects the organization for upcoming tough internal or customer meetings (if necessary also in fluent Japanese - whatever he explained here during the Audit ;-) ). Although definitely missing other important characteristics, I'd like to finish by summarizing: Roman is one of the key persons who made a huge change possible in the quality organization during the last 4.5 years. Thank you, Roman

recommendationHistory.caption: February 9, 2017, Andreas was Roman’s client
recommendationHistory.description: I had the pleasure working with Roman for more then 1 year on a very challenging project in regard to supplier excellence management with a global group of VAT's key suppliers. With his hands-on mentality and leadership he was the key person to make this project a big success. I have appreciated his  contribution to VAT's Quality program very much!

recommendationHistory.caption: July 8, 2016, Roman was senior to Pero but didn't manage Pero directly
recommendationHistory.description:
Ich habe Roman als sehr kompetenten immer mit positiver Energie geladenen Vorgesetzten kennengelernt, der es verstand seine Mitarbeiter mit seiner durchaus positiven art zu motivieren. Er erkennt komplexe Zusammenhänge sehr schnell und strebt mit seinem Team immer nach nachhaltigen Lösungen. Seine open door policy habe ich immer sehr geschätzt. Ebenfalls empfand ich seine ehrliche und offene Kommunikation immer positiv.
In einem Satz würde ich Roman als Mann der Taten und nich nur der Worte beschreiben.

recommendationHistory.caption: July 6, 2016, Andreas worked with Roman but on different teams
recommendationHistory.description: Working with Roman Rauper is a pleasure as he is highly motivated and has reached with his focused attitude to work the project goal to implement a new supplier quality system with VAT Vakuumventile AG. His special skill is that he is very fast in understanding of the needs and requirements. Based on this analysis he has created a project plan which could successfully implemented withing the defined time frame.

recommendationHistory.caption: November 8, 2013, Philippe was senior to Roman but didn't manage Roman directly
recommendationHistory.description:
Roman is direct, efficient and get things done. He knows how to communicate clearly his goals and expectations to his peers, his subordinates and his management. He is a real achiever.
In his role at ADB, he was a relentless advocate of our customers in our organisation, pushing for better quality and service. With energy and strong will, he was able to get cooperation of all involved people to deliver better and better performance. I strongly recommend Roman. He can take tough challenges and make things happen.

recommendationHistory.caption: September 9, 2013, Arthur worked with Roman but on different teams
recommendationHistory.description: Before I met Roman, I don't believe the QC and Operation Process Management can be a key engine for drive the whole organization in crazy innovative development,  but it came to truth while he led the Asian TQPM team. With his Swiss humor and Japanese-style serious on job, he is a real warrior and QC and PM master in workplace.

recommendationHistory.caption: July 13, 2011, Thomas worked with Roman on the same team
recommendationHistory.description: I experienced Roman as a fact-based and driven senior manager, who is open-minded and multi-cultural. His spirit and humour helped him achieve excellent work progress even in a challenging environment.

company.name: SFS Group
company.tagline: Inventing success together
company.description:
At SFS Group, our approximately 13,200 employees – our "Value Creators" – are at the centre of everything we do. With them, we are present in 35 countries with over 140 manufacturing and distribution sites.

SFS is a worldwide leading supplier of application-critical precision components and assemblies, mechanical fastening systems, quality tools and procurement solutions. SFS Group AG operates in the three segments Engineered Components, Fastening Systems and Distribution & Logistics, which represent the company’s different business models.

In the Engineered Components segment, SFS partners with customers to develop and manufacture customer-specific precision-molded parts, assemblies and fastening solutions. Engineered Components comprises three divisions: Automotive, Electronics and Medical & Industrial Specials.

The Fastening Systems segment, which consists of the Construction division, develops, manufactures and markets application-specific mechanical fastening systems. 

In the Distribution & Logistics segment, SFS is a leading sales partner in Europe for direct and indirect materials in the areas of quality tools, fasteners and other C-parts as well as logistics and process solutions for customers in industrial and construction sectors. The segment comprises two divisions, Distribution & Logistics Switzerland and Distribution & Logistics International.

With its "Value Creators", the SFS Group generated sales of CHF 3,090.8 million in the 2023 financial year.

person.headline: Sustainability | Compliance, Emissions, Circularity
person.summary: Sustainability Manager with a passion for a circular economy and a fascination for energy technology. Collaborating across disciplines, devoted to tackling the most pressing ESG issues of today's industry, while avidly staying fit across various sports and engaging others to join me - for both!

positionHistory.title: Head of Sustainability
positionHistory.description:
- Leading corporate team of five, while providing functional leadership to the global ESG/EHS community.
- Creating compliance programs for the key regulations CSRD, LKSG, CBAM, EU Taxonomy
- Creating the annual sustainability report
- Formulating a net-zero carbon emissions Science Based Target and executing its associated roadmap
- Assist Bid Management by interpreting and implementing customers' sustainability requirements

positionHistory.title: Global Sustainability Manager for Robotics & Discrete Automation
positionHistory.description:
- Created and implemented the sustainability business strategy, set targets, and managed the program with multiple stakeholders.
- Led initiatives towards achieving net zero emissions, establishing a circular business model, and ensuring diligent human rights management, while effectively communicating these efforts.
- Within ABB's Sustainability Council, spearheaded initiatives on green electricity procurement, CO2 reduction in the supply chain, and co-developed ABB's Circularity Framework with sustainability colleagues from various divisions.
- Drove and supported all business functions in transitioning to a sustainable business model across the entire value chain.

positionHistory.title: Country Environmental Manager
positionHistory.description:
- At ABB Global HQ, served as a Global Environmental Specialist with additional responsibilities as the Country Environmental Manager for ABB Switzerland.
- Provided practical and legal support for Swiss factories in achieving their environmental targets, offering internal expertise, ensuring environmental legal compliance, conducting internal audits, establishing nationwide energy and waste contracts, and securing funding for environmental improvement projects.
- Officially represented ABB's environmental interests to external stakeholders, including media, government, customers, and NGOs.

Key Achievements:
- Transitioned all ABB sites in Switzerland to green electricity.
- Initiated policy and roadmap for electrification of the entire vehicle fleet.
- Implemented new recycling systems.
- Negotiated a 10-year Energy & CO2 reduction contract with the government.
- Secured over 200,000 CHF annually in external funding for energy efficiency projects.
- Replaced the natural gas heating system of the Corporate Research Campus in Dättwil with a local wood waste furnace.

positionHistory.title: Global Environmental Specialist
positionHistory.description:
- Managed global Group environmental reporting for over 700 sites, including IT design, roll-out, virtual training, process improvement using lean six-sigma methodology, data analysis, and external reporting in accordance with GRI and GHG Protocol Standards.
- Acted as a liaison on sustainability topics with media, investors, government officials, and NGOs, and reported to ESG rating agencies such as CDP and EcoVadis.
- Set ABB's Group sustainability targets for 2020-2030, including establishing a Science Based Target for carbon emissions.
- Led cross-functional projects to quantify Scope 3 emissions and design reduction pathways in supply chain, logistics, and at customer sites.
- Engaged the matrix organization to achieve sustainability targets.
- Supported business sustainability professionals with everyday environmental challenges, such as green energy procurement, implementing waste management systems, conserving water in water-stressed areas, and managing hazardous chemicals in the supply chain.

- Hands-on building low-cost biodigesters and rainwater harvesting and filtration systems

company.name: Stadler
company.tagline: At Stadler, we are driven every day to do everything we can for the world's best rail vehicles.
company.description: International rail vehicle construction company, Stadler, is headquartered in Bussnang in Eastern Switzerland. Founded in 1942, it has a workforce of around 11,000 based in various production and over 40 service locations. Stadler provides a comprehensive range of products in the heavy and urban transport segments: High-speed trains, intercity trains, regional and commuter heavy rail trains, underground trains, tram trains and trams. Stadler also manufactures main-line locomotives, shunting locomotives and passenger carriages, including the most powerful diesel-electric locomotive in Europe. It is the world’s leading manufacturer in the rack-and-pinion rail vehicle industry.

company.name: RUAG
company.tagline: Technology partner of the Swiss Armed Forces. For sovereign security.
company.description:
We at RUAG play a vital role in keeping Switzerland secure. For sovereign security. Always and everywhere. Security is one of the basic pillars of Switzerland. That is what our 2500 employees work for every day: at over 15 locations in Switzerland and abroad. That is what drives us. For our customers and for Switzerland. As the visionary thinking technology partner of the Swiss Armed Forces, our priorities are life cycle management, operations and availability for military systems.

RUAG as an employer
RUAG offers you a modern, inspiring and supportive working environment. We maintain a motivating working atmosphere where your personal goals can be met and exceeded. We encourage and challenge you to perform the best you can in order to make a contribution to Swiss security together.

Air Systems
Through the maintenance of planes and helicopters, we guarantee comprehensive support throughout the entire life cycle, and ensure availability and performance.

Land Systems
As a highly-capable partner for land systems, we at RUAG support military forces and security organizations in the successful execution of their operations.

Communications, Guidance & Reconnaissance Systems
We ensure that state-of-the-art technologies for network-enabled operations are available at any time, and in doing so support the Swiss Armed Forces and blue-light organizations.

Additional Services & Products
Through our wide-ranging portfolio of operations for air, land, and communications systems, we possess many years of in-depth specialist knowledge in the fields of aerodynamics, testing, and ICT consulting.

company.name: Stadler
company.tagline: At Stadler, we are driven every day to do everything we can for the world's best rail vehicles.
company.description: International rail vehicle construction company, Stadler, is headquartered in Bussnang in Eastern Switzerland. Founded in 1942, it has a workforce of around 11,000 based in various production and over 40 service locations. Stadler provides a comprehensive range of products in the heavy and urban transport segments: High-speed trains, intercity trains, regional and commuter heavy rail trains, underground trains, tram trains and trams. Stadler also manufactures main-line locomotives, shunting locomotives and passenger carriages, including the most powerful diesel-electric locomotive in Europe. It is the world’s leading manufacturer in the rack-and-pinion rail vehicle industry.

"𝘋𝘰𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘵𝘩𝘪𝘯𝘨𝘴 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘥𝘰𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘮 𝘳𝘪𝘨𝘩𝘵".

I've always believed that this sentence encompasses meaning both for me and for who gets in touch with me. And day after day, both personal and working experiences have been stubbornly confirming this to me.

3 are the strengths that people use to describe me:

1.	𝐌𝐞𝐭𝐡𝐨𝐝𝐢𝐜𝐚𝐥 approach to pull out the best from every situation 
2.	𝐓𝐫𝐮𝐬𝐭𝐰𝐨𝐫𝐭𝐡𝐢𝐧𝐞𝐬𝐬 about the promises I make and the right flexibility to keep them
3.	𝐎𝐩𝐞𝐧𝐧𝐞𝐬𝐬 and 𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐡𝐮𝐬𝐢𝐚𝐬𝐦 towards changes 

I am strongly convinced that all of this perfectly fits with Interroll and my daily job.
What about testing me?

positionHistory.title: Head of Maintenance and Production Engineering
positionHistory.description:
Managing all activities involving maintenance of machines and molds (preventive, breakdown and improvement tasks).
Leading a team of 7 people on a daily basis to guarantee full productivity for Operations.

The main responsibilities are:
- Cover the industrialization process for machineries to be installed on the shopfloor, from specs requirement, through FAT and SAT and first sampling
- Coordinate both machine and mold maintenance to minimize breakdowns and downtime, improving productivity
- Actively define budget for maintenance project and activities, and respect the agreed plan
- Promote continuous improvement activities throughout the department and proactively help other departments to implement successful solutions

positionHistory.title: Production Engineer
positionHistory.description:
Taking care of the repeatability of the production process, focusing especially on the industrialization stage for the injection molding and assembly departments.

In charge for the project management of automation and digitalization activities regarding productions, such as machines, robots, automated cells and data collection from production devices.

The tasks involve as well:
- Active support to continuous improvement activities
- Data-driven decision making, offering consistent and reliable data
- Machine requirements and standard work definition for production process
- Personnel technical training to guarantee proper technology usage
- Machine purchase negotiation, considering safety/certification requirements

positionHistory.title: Technical Sales and Head of Testing
positionHistory.description:
Promoting Interroll SA as injection molding partner, taking care of marketing activities and customer relationships (e.g. fair, website, direct contact with customers).

Coordinating testing activities to certify conformity of Interroll SA products via regular tests and arranging trials to homologate new products/materials.

- Scouting new partners and managing relationships with existing customers
- Managing marketing activities and promotion events for Interroll SA
- Technical support to customers and understanding of their needs
- Coordinating the execution of mold tests, additionally to static and dynamic tests
- Involved along product validation process for releasing new articles
- Handling potential claims directly with customers

positionHistory.title: Head of Quality & Product Validation
positionHistory.description:
Guaranteeing the quality of Interroll products along the whole production line, from validation of new articles up to their series production.

- Coordinating a team of 3 people for tests and quality checks
- Regularly carrying out mold tests, additionally to static and dynamic test
- Involved along product validation process for releasing new articles
- Promoting and validating new technologies to be used in the shopfloor
- Handling potential claims directly with customers

positionHistory.title: Testing Specialist
positionHistory.description:
Working in the Product Testing department at Interroll SA, I am in charge of testing the technopolymer articles designed for internal logistic solutions.
In further detail, my job ranges through different tasks, such as:

- Testing Laboratory management
- Dynamic and static testing on technopolymer products
- Reports to Product Engineering and Management departments
- Product inspection to verify compliance with customer technical specifications
- Calibration of measurement instruments used throughout the factory
- Injection molding tests management
- Working with international colleagues from all branches of the company

positionHistory.title: Vehicle Dynamics Engineer
positionHistory.description:
Being part of the Cyber Tyre team, I carried on the project developed during my internship for future implementation in the commercial solution.
Additionally to what experienced along the previous period, I dealt with:

- Light Truck acquisition system setting up for endurance test
- Truck acquisition system setting up for outdoor test

positionHistory.title: Intern
positionHistory.description:
Internship to prepare for my Master thesis exam

Development of a new innovative algorithm to extend tyre life and improve tyre management for truck fleets by means of a sensor attached to the tyre. 
During my experience at Cyberfleet™ division, I dealt with:

- Analysis of data previously collected by testing department
- Outdoor testing for data acquisition and algorithm validation
- Working in a team of 5 experienced people
- Meeting with external international partners
- Preparation of test specifications and products
- Data analysis and test reports for internal use and release to suppliers / customers
- Teamwork, planning and high-level management of complex projects

positionHistory.title: Trainee
positionHistory.description:
Project to prepare for my bachelor thesis exam.

Analysis of dynamics and kinematics of an electrical circuit breaker through 3D modeling (using CAD-CAE softwares such as CATIA and LMS Virtual.Lab), with particular emphasis on the study of the forces involved.
As a result of our simulations with Virtual.Lab, an alternative and more user-friendly design was developed by our work group

educationHistory.description: Exchange student at ika (Institut für Kraftfahrzeuge)

company.name: Interroll Group
company.tagline: Interroll Group is the leading global provider of material handling solutions.
company.description: The Interroll Group is the world's leading provider of material handling solutions. The company was founded in 1959 and has been listed on the SIX Swiss Exchange since 1997. Interroll supplies system integrators and equipment manufacturers with a comprehensive range of platform-based products and services in the categories "Rollers" (conveyor rollers), "Drives" (motors and drives for conveyor systems), "Conveyors & Sorters" (conveyors & sorters) and "Pallet Handling" (pallet conveying and storage). Interroll solutions are used in express and postal services, e-commerce, airports, food & beverage, fashion, automotive and other industries. The company counts leading brands such as Amazon, Bosch, Coca-Cola, DHL, Nestlé, Procter & Gamble, Siemens, Walmart and Zalando among its users. Headquartered in Switzerland, Interroll has a global network of 35 companies with a turnover of 664.4 CHF million and 2,500 employees (average number of employees in 2022).

company.name: Burckhardt Compression
company.tagline: We create leading compression solutions for a sustainable energy future
company.description: Burckhardt Compression creates leading compression solutions for a sustainable energy future and the long-term success of its customers. Together with its brands Burckhardt Compression, PROGNOST, SAMR Métal Rouge and Shenyang Yuanda Compressor, the Group is the only global manufacturer that covers a full range of reciprocating compressor technologies and services. Its customized and modularized compressor systems are used in the Chemical/Petrochemical, Gas Transport & Storage, Hydrogen Mobility & Energy and Industrial Gas sectors as well as for applications in Refinery and Gas Gathering & Processing. Since 1844, its passionate, customer-oriented and solution-driven workforce has set the benchmark in the gas compression industry.

company.name: dormakaba Schweiz AG
company.description:
Wir sind einer der Top-3-Anbieter unserer Branche und weltweit führend in smarten und sicheren Zutrittslösungen. Wir bieten Ihnen alles was Sie brauchen für sicheren Zutritt zu Gebäuden und Räumen aus einer Hand.

Mit mehr als 150 Jahren Erfahrung in allen Bereichen der Zutritts- und Sicherheitstechnik arbeiten wir kontinuierlich an Innovationen und liefern unseren Kunden auf der ganzen Welt die besten Produkte, Lösungen und Services.

«For every place that matters»
Unser Purpose steht für unseren gesellschaftlichen Beitrag: Wir sind dort, wo wir als Einzelne zusammenkommen und zu einer Gemeinschaft werden. An Orten ganz in der Nähe – oder irgendwo auf der Welt. In Schulen und Universitäten, in Stadien, Flughäfen, Krankenhäusern und Bürogebäuden. Für diese Orte ermöglichen wir Sicherheit, Schutz und Nachhaltigkeit, damit sich Menschen nahtlos bewegen und ihr Leben gestalten können.

recommendationHistory.caption: May 24, 2013, Roger was Dr Toni’s client
recommendationHistory.description:
I liaised with and coached Roger during 2012/13 whilst he developed his portfolio for accreditation as a Lean Coach at Wartsila.  
He has successfully developed and project managed a variety of challenging continuous improvement programmes across the Wartsila Switzerland site.  He demonstrated hard work, diligence, tenacity, and creativity in addition to well developed interpersonal and coaching skills.. His role and the training programme at Wartsila, developed with support from S A Partners provided ample opportunity for Roger to submit a portfolio to a high standard, resulting in accreditation and certification to the Cardiff University Lean Competency System - 2A/Lean Coach level.
In particular, his involvement in the evaluation of the current state of the 2 stroke business process was an excellent piece of work, resulting in a roadmap for improvements which will benefit Wartsila and more importantly, their customers.

company.name: Bossard Group
company.tagline: We bring Proven Productivity and sustainability to every assembly operation in the world!
company.description:
The Bossard Group, headquartered in Zug, Switzerland, is among the global market leaders in fastening technology. With more than 1 million fastening elements in our product portfolio as well as our related technical consulting and logistics services, we enable our customers to increase their productivity and manufacturing efficiency sustainably.

Bossard is a global network of companies with currently about 2,900 employees in 35 countries across Europe, the Americas, and the Asia-Pacific region. Our drive for excellence and innovation has led to steady growth and success for more than 190 years now.

Whether you are in need of screws, nuts, bolts, rivets, or something else, we have the right fastener for every application. In addition, our engineers help you find the perfect solution to optimize your products’ fastener design (Assembly Technology Expert Services).

We also offer intelligent solutions for your inventory and c-parts management, leveraging the power of Industry 4.0 and IOT (Smart Factory Logistics). Our Smart Factory Assembly service helps increase process reliability as well as efficiency in your assembly – for the optimal output in your manufacturing.

Learn more about Bossard at www.bossard.com/global-en/about-us/

Mgr. (Liebherr COmponent Technologies).

person.headline: Global Head of Sustainability at LEM l CIA I ex EY I Ultrarunner
person.summary:
As Head of Sustainability at LEM, I am leading the company's transformation toward sustainability and compliance to various ESG regulations in Switzerland and Europe. Every day I am supporting LEM's purpose helping customers and society accelerate the transition to a sustainable future. 

Former Risk professional, managing the 3 key Risk areas: Internal Controls, Entreprise Risk Management and Internal Audit at LEM. I successfully reshaped those 3 functions to be now considered as real assets for the company. My successful work was pledged by the Executive Committee.

positionHistory.title: Head of Risk, Control & Audit
positionHistory.description:
Heading and managing the 3 key risks functions within LEM :
- Internal Audit 
- Internal Control
- Entreprise Risk Management

Successfully reshaped and managed those 3 functions.

Internal Audit: 
- Redefinition the whole IA governance and key documents
- Audit Plan definition:
o Define yearly audit plans based on proven risk assessment methodology and various inputs (Top Management, Exco, AC, BoD)
o Establish budget and internal audit scoping
o Validate it with CFO and Audit Committee
o Roll out to the entities concerned

- Fieldwork activities:
o Manage a team of internal auditors on site and remotely
o Prepare (interview, planning, team briefing etc)
o Fieldwork (from kick off meeting, research for operational risks in processes, conduct interviews & testing, report writing and recommendations issuing to closing meeting).
Scope of the process audits included: Procurement to Pay, Inventory & Production, Order to cash, Budget, Treasury, CAPEX, HR & Payroll, compliance aspects, corporate Governance, GDPR.

- Reporting & communication:
o To local General Managers on result of fieldwork
o To CFO on current and upcoming IA activities
o To AC and BoD on IA strategy and main weaknesses found during IA activities

Internal Controls: 
- Reworked the whole ICS framework to ensure consistency among the controls
- Prioritize the controls to be conducted 

Entreprise Risk Management: 
- Redefine the ERM methodology and the whole governance around ERM. 
- Conduct yearly ERM assessments: interview of senior executives, identification and definition of the main risks and their underlying drivers, heat map compilation.
- Workshop preparation and restitution of the results in front of the senior executive audience and leading debate.
- Support Risk Owners in the definition of mitigation actions in line with the strategy
- Communication of the result to Exco, AC and BoD + follow up

Other: 
- Supervise other risk topics such as ERP access rights and all group insurance topics
